What is Private Label Clothing Manufacturing?

Private label means we manufacture clothing products specifically for your brand. Unlike buying wholesale (existing products) or generic white-label items, private label gives you complete control over every aspect of your product:

üé®

Design Control

  • ‚Ä¢ Choose fabrics, colors, patterns
  • ‚Ä¢ Custom sizing and fit
  • ‚Ä¢ Unique style details
  • ‚Ä¢ Your specifications, not ours
üè∑Ô∏è

Brand Ownership

  • ‚Ä¢ Your brand name and logo
  • ‚Ä¢ Custom woven/printed labels
  • ‚Ä¢ Branded hang tags
  • ‚Ä¢ Exclusive to your brand
üì¶

Packaging & Presentation

  • ‚Ä¢ Custom poly bags with logo
  • ‚Ä¢ Branded packaging boxes
  • ‚Ä¢ Inserts and thank you cards
  • ‚Ä¢ Professional presentation
üë•

Market Exclusivity

  • ‚Ä¢ Products exclusive to you
  • ‚Ä¢ We don't sell to competitors
  • ‚Ä¢ Build unique brand identity
  • ‚Ä¢ No marketplace saturation

Private Label vs Wholesale vs Cut & Sew:

‚Ä¢ Private Label: Our existing styles + your custom fabrics/colors/branding (Fastest, cost-effective)

‚Ä¢ Wholesale: Buy existing products and resell (No customization, lowest cost)

‚Ä¢ Cut & Sew (Fully Custom): Patterns from scratch (Unlimited design freedom, highest cost)

Our 8-Step Private Label Process

Step 1

Brand Consultation

Discuss your vision, target market, and product ideas. We provide fabric suggestions, pricing estimates, and feasibility analysis.

Step 2

Tech Pack Development

Create or refine technical specifications. Includes pattern making, grading (XS-XXL), fabric selection, trim details, and construction methods.

Step 3

Sample Production

5-7 days to produce physical samples with your custom labels and branding. Revisions included until you approve fit and quality.

Step 4

Branding Setup

Design and produce custom woven labels, care labels, hang tags, packaging. You approve all branding elements before bulk production.

Step 5

Order Confirmation

30% deposit secures production slot. Final spec sheet, timeline, and shipping method confirmed. Pre-production meeting via video call.

Step 6

Bulk Production

15-20 days for 50-500 pieces. Daily production updates. In-line quality checks at cutting, sewing, and finishing stages.

Step 7

Final QC & Packaging

AQL 2.5 inspection standard. Each piece checked for stitching, measurements, print quality. Custom packaging applied. Photos sent for approval.

Step 8

Shipping & Delivery

Air freight (7-10 days) or sea (18-25 days). Full tracking provided. Amazon FBA prep if needed. Customs support included.

Private Label vs Wholesale vs Cut & Sew

FeaturePrivate Label (Our Specialty)WholesaleCut & Sew (Custom)
Design FreedomHigh (use our patterns)None (buy as-is)Complete (100% custom)
Minimum Order50 pieces1-10 pieces200-500 pieces
Cost per Piece$$ (Mid-range)$ (Lowest)$$$ (Highest)
Custom BrandingYes (full branding)Limited or noneYes (full branding)
Production Time15-20 daysImmediate (in stock)30-45 days
Brand ExclusivityYes (exclusive to you)No (shared products)Yes (exclusive)
Fabric/Color ChoiceFull controlPre-selected onlyFull control
Best ForFashion startups, DTC brandsResellers, boutiquesEstablished brands

Recommendation: Start with Private Label for low risk and fast launch. Scale to Cut & Sew as your brand grows.

Frequently Asked Questions

What exactly is private label clothing manufacturing?

Private label manufacturing means we produce clothing according to your specifications and brand it exclusively for you. You provide the designs, we manufacture the products, and they're sold under your brand name. Unlike wholesale (buying existing products), private label gives you full control over design, fabrics, colors, sizing, and branding. You own the designs, we handle production.

What's the minimum order for private label clothing?

Our private label MOQ is 50 pieces per style per color. This is significantly lower than traditional private label manufacturers who typically require 500-1,000 pieces. Our low MOQ is perfect for fashion startups testing new designs, DTC brands launching limited collections, or established brands adding new product lines with minimal risk.

Do you help with design and tech pack development?

Yes! Many of our private label clients are first-time brand owners. We offer tech pack development support ($50-150 per design) where our team converts your sketches or ideas into professional specifications. We'll help with pattern making, grading, fabric selection, trim specifications, and construction details. This service ensures your vision becomes production-ready.

Can you create custom woven or printed labels for my brand?

Absolutely! We produce custom woven labels (damask, taffeta, satin), printed labels (care labels, size labels), hang tags, and packaging. Woven labels start at $0.15-0.30 per label with 50-piece minimums. We can also source custom buttons, zippers, drawcords, and other branded trims. Complete branding solutions available.

How much does private label clothing manufacturing cost?

Costs depend on product complexity, fabric choice, and order volume. Basic private label t-shirts: $4.50-$6.00/piece (50 pcs). Premium hoodies: $15.00-$20.00/piece (50 pcs). Activewear: $10.00-$15.00/piece (50 pcs). These prices include fabric, labor, standard printing/embroidery, custom labels, and poly bags. Additional costs: custom hang tags ($0.10-0.25), special packaging, and shipping.

What's the difference between private label and cut & sew manufacturing?

Private label typically uses our existing patterns with your custom fabrics, colors, and branding‚Äîfaster and more cost-effective. Cut & sew (fully custom) means we create patterns from scratch based on your unique designs‚Äîmore expensive and longer lead times but unlimited design freedom. For startups, we recommend starting with private label then transitioning to cut & sew as you scale.

Can I use my own fabrics or must I use yours?

Both options available! Most clients use our fabric sourcing (faster, better pricing through our suppliers). However, if you want specific fabrics, you can provide them or we can source them for you. If shipping your own fabric to Bangladesh, expect 2-3 week delays for customs clearance. We recommend fabric samples first to ensure quality meets standards.

How long does private label production take?

Timeline: Tech pack finalization (3-5 days) ‚Üí Sample production (5-7 days) ‚Üí Sample shipping (3-5 days) ‚Üí Your approval (your timeline) ‚Üí Bulk production (15-20 days for 50-500 pcs) ‚Üí Shipping (7-10 days air or 18-25 days sea). Total: 35-50 days from start to delivery. Rush production available for 20% surcharge (10-12 day production).

Do you offer packaging and fulfillment services?

Yes! We offer poly bagging, custom packaging boxes, hang tags, stickers, and inserts. For Amazon FBA sellers, we provide FBA prep: FNSKU labeling, suffocation warnings, carton requirements. We can also arrange fulfillment partnerships in USA if you need warehousing and order processing. Let us know your requirements and we'll quote accordingly.

What if I want to switch manufacturers later‚Äîdo I own the patterns?

Yes, you own all patterns, tech packs, and designs we create for you. If you switch manufacturers, we'll provide digital pattern files and spec sheets. We hope you won't leave (our service is great!), but we believe in transparency. Many clients start with us for small batches and continue as they scale because of our quality and flexibility.

Ready to Launch Your Private Label Brand?
